verses.text: 認罪禱告的結果以斯拉禱告、認罪、哭泣，俯伏在 神的殿前的時候，有一大群以色列人，包括男女小孩，在他面前聚集；眾人也都痛哭。

words.note: A verb-object compound common in religious contexts.
A verb-object compound meaning 'to pray, to make an appeal'.
Often used in religious or formal contexts to describe showing reverence.
The preceding space is a deference marker in traditional Chinese text.
Here, it forms a temporal clause 'when...'.

verses.text: 屬以攔的子孫、耶歇的兒子示迦尼對以斯拉說：「我們對 神不忠，娶了這地這外族女子為妻。雖然這樣，以色列現在還有希望。

words.note: Refers to a person here, ancestor of a lineage.
The preceding space is a deference marker.
Refers to disloyalty or unfaithfulness to God.
A verb-object compound meaning 'to take as a wife'.

verses.text: 現在，我們應當與我們的 神立約，按著我主和那些因我們 神的誡命而戰兢的人所議定的，照著律法而行，送走這些妻子和她們所生的兒女。

words.note: The preceding space is a deference marker.
A fixed phrase referring to establishing an agreement, especially a divine covenant.
The preceding space is a deference marker.
Describes trembling out of reverence or fear, common in religious texts.
Used before verbs to form a passive or nominalized phrase.
Refers specifically to religious law, like the Mosaic Law.

verses.text: 你起來！因為這事全在你身上，我們支持你，你當堅強地去作。」

words.note: Figurative: 'the responsibility rests upon you'.
Used to link an adjective to a verb, forming an adverbial phrase.

verses.text: 於是以斯拉起來，使祭司首領、利未人和以色列眾人起誓要照著這話去行；他們就起誓。
以斯拉就從 神的殿前起來，走進以利亞實的兒子約哈難的屋裡去；他在那裡不吃飯，也不喝水，因為他為了被擄歸回的人的不忠而悲傷。

words.note: Refers to the God of the Bible.
Often refers to the Temple in Jerusalem.
Refers to the exiles returning from Babylon.
Here, unfaithfulness to God/covenant.

verses.text: 於是，領袖們就在猶大和耶路撒冷向所有被擄歸回的人發出通告，叫他們到耶路撒冷聚集。

words.note: Refers to the exiles returning from Babylon.

verses.text: 所有不照著眾領袖和眾長老所議定，在三日之內來到的人，所有的財物都要充公，也要從被擄歸回之人的會中被逐出。

words.note: Refers to a specific role in a religious community.
Refers to the exiles returning from Babylon.
Connects attribute to noun, similar to 'de' 的.
Refers to the community or congregation.

verses.text: 於是猶大和便雅憫眾人，三日之內都在耶路撒冷聚集，那時是九月二十日，眾人坐在神殿的廣場上；因為這事，又因為天下大雨的緣故，大家就都戰慄發抖。

words.note: Refers to the tribe or people of Judah.
Refers to the tribe or people of Benjamin.
Refers to the Temple in Jerusalem.
In '天下大雨', it implies 'heavy rain falling from the sky'.

verses.text: 以斯拉祭司站起來，對他們說：「你們對 神不忠，娶了外族的女子為妻，增添了以色列的罪過。

words.note: Refers to the God of the Bible.
Here, unfaithfulness to God/covenant.
Often used in religious contexts for moral/spiritual transgression.

verses.text: 現在你們要向耶和華你們列祖的 神認罪，遵行他所喜悅的旨意，與這地的民族和外族的女子分離。」

words.note: A transliteration of the Hebrew name for God.
Refers to the singular God, often capitalized in biblical texts.
Verb-object compound: 'admit sin'.
Often indicates a passive or a general object.
Often refers to God's will.

verses.text: 全體會眾都大聲回答說：「你怎麼說，我們就怎麼行。

words.note: Commonly used in religious contexts for a gathering of believers.
Indicates a consequence or result.

verses.text: 可是人太多，又逢下大雨的季節，我們不能停留在外面；這又不是一兩天可以完成的事，因為我們很多人在這事上犯了罪！

words.note: Describes heavy rain, literally 'fall big rain'.
Used as a postposition to mean 'in/on this matter'.
Verb-object compound with aspect particle: 'committed sin'.

verses.text: 讓我們的領袖代表全體會眾站在耶和華面前，所有在我們的城中娶了外族女子為妻的人，也都要在指定的日期，與本城的長老和審判官一起來，解決了這事，好使 神因這事所發的烈怒離開我們。」

words.note: Refers to respected leaders, often in a community or church.
Literally 'good to make/cause'.

verses.text: 只有亞撒黑的兒子約拿單和特瓦的兒子雅哈謝起來反對這提議，還有米書蘭和利未人沙比太支持他們。

words.note: Members of the tribe of Levi, serving in religious capacities.

verses.text: 於是，被擄歸回的人就這樣行。以斯拉祭司提名選派了一些人，是各宗族的族長，於十月初一他們一同坐下來查辦這事。

words.note: Lit. 'to be captured'

words.definition: chief of a clan, tribal elder

words.note: Refers to the first day of a lunar month in ancient contexts, often 'New Moon'.

verses.text: 直到正月初一，他們才完成審查所有娶了外族的女子為妻的人。

words.note: Refers to the first day of a lunar month in ancient contexts, often 'New Moon'.

words.definition: as wife, to be a wife
words.note: Formal or classical way to say 'take as wife'.

verses.text: 娶異族女子為妻者的名單在祭司子孫中，娶了外族的女子為妻的有耶書亞的子孫，約薩達的兒子和他的兄弟瑪西雅、以利以謝、雅立、基大利。

words.definition: as wife, to be a wife
as wife, to be a wife

verses.text: 他們舉手起誓要送走他們的妻子，並獻贖罪祭。他們就獻上一隻公綿羊，作他們的贖罪祭。

words.note: To make a solemn promise or declaration.

words.definition: will, want to, be going to

verses.text: 音麥的子孫中，有哈拿尼和西巴第雅。
哈琳的子孫中，有瑪西雅、以利雅、示瑪雅、耶歇和烏西雅。
巴施戶珥的子孫中，有以利約乃、瑪西雅、以實瑪利、拿坦業、約撒拔和以利亞撒。
利未人中有約撒拔、示每、基拉雅（又叫基利他），還有毗他希雅、猶大和以利以謝。

words.note: Refers to the priestly tribe of Levi.

verses.text: 歌唱者中，有以利亞實。守門的人中，有沙龍、提聯和烏利。
屬以色列人的巴錄的子孫中，有拉米、耶西雅、瑪基雅、米雅民、以利亞撒、瑪基雅、比拿雅。

words.note: Refers to the people of Israel.

verses.text: 以攔的子孫中，有瑪他尼、撒迦利亞、耶歇、押底、耶利末和以利雅。
薩土的子孫中，有以利約乃、以利亞實、瑪他尼、耶利末、撒拔和亞西撒。
比拜的子孫中，有約哈難、哈拿尼雅、薩拜和亞勒。
巴尼的子孫中，有米書蘭、瑪鹿、亞大雅、雅述、示押和耶利末。
巴哈．摩押的子孫中，有阿底拿、基拉、比拿雅、瑪西雅、瑪他尼、比撒列、賓內和瑪拿西。

words.note: The '．' is a transliteration separator for hyphenated names.

verses.text: 哈琳的子孫中，有以利以謝、伊示雅、瑪基雅、示瑪雅、西緬、
便雅憫、瑪鹿和示瑪利雅。
哈順的子孫中，有瑪特乃、瑪達他、撒拔、以利法列、耶利買、瑪拿西和示每。
巴尼的子孫中，有瑪代、暗蘭、烏益、
比拿雅、比底雅、基祿、
瓦尼雅、米利末、以利亞實、

words.note: A biblical personal name, transliterated from Hebrew.
A biblical personal name, transliterated from Hebrew.
A biblical personal name, transliterated from Hebrew.

verses.text: 瑪他尼、瑪特乃、雅掃、

words.note: A biblical personal name, transliterated from Hebrew.
A biblical personal name, transliterated from Hebrew.
A biblical personal name, transliterated from Hebrew.

verses.text: 巴尼、賓內、示每、

words.note: A biblical personal name, transliterated from Hebrew.
A biblical personal name, transliterated from Hebrew.
A biblical personal name, transliterated from Hebrew.

verses.text: 示利米雅、拿單、亞大雅、

words.note: A biblical personal name, transliterated from Hebrew.
A biblical personal name, transliterated from Hebrew.
A biblical personal name, transliterated from Hebrew.

verses.text: 瑪拿底拜、沙賽、沙賴、

words.note: A biblical personal name, transliterated from Hebrew.
A biblical personal name, transliterated from Hebrew.
A biblical personal name, transliterated from Hebrew.

verses.text: 亞薩利、示利米雅、示瑪利雅、
沙龍、亞瑪利雅、約瑟。
尼波的子孫中，有耶利、瑪他提雅、撒拔、西比拿、雅玳、約珥和比拿雅。
這些人都娶了外族的女子為妻，但他們都把妻子和兒女送走了（本節經文殘缺，意義難確定，或譯︰「有的妻子也生了兒女」）。

words.note: Specifically refers to a man taking a wife.
Contextually 'gentile' or 'non-Israelite'.
Used to introduce a role or status.
Introduces the object of a verb, which precedes the verb.
送走 is a verb-complement compound, 了 is a perfective aspect particle.
Describes something that is damaged or parts are missing.
Often seen in Bible commentaries or footnotes.
Here, it forms a nominal phrase meaning 'some (of them)' or 'some who...'
